text:
My name is Nova and I'm an AWS
Developer at a tech company in Japan.

I work part time and remotely
from a small district in East Java, Indonesia.

My background is in physics and after
completing my masters degree in 2019,

I aimed for an academic career
but had to rethink my options.

After graduation, I saw there was a 
very high demand for cloud talent

and underwent training in cloud 
computing through AWS Educate.

AWS Educate was my very
first introduction to the cloud.

It provides practical, hands-on labs
on the AWS Management Console

and theoretical cloud basics in language
that’s easy for beginners to understand.

I didn’t know anything about 
the cloud before

AWS Educate opened my eyes
to the possibility of a cloud career,
something I’d never considered before.

Because of AWS Educate
I had the opportunity

to work on real world projects and gain
hands-on experience with AWS services,

which was instrumental
in building my practical skills.

From that point, I was inspired to 
learn more about cloud computing.

I’ve achieved two AWS Certifications,
which has boosted my confidence!

I was able to secure a 
remote part time technical job

and now I can spend more 
time with my family

and better balance
life as a working mum.
